# Verizon's Network Infrastructure Leadership

## This Week's Key Insight
Verizon's C-band 5G network now covers 230 million Americans, achieving 90% of deployment targets six months ahead of schedule and positioning the carrier ahead of competitors in mid-band 5G dominance.

## Key Developments
- **230 Million POPs Covered**: Verizon's C-band 5G reaches 230M people across 2,100+ cities
- **45,000 Cell Sites Deployed**: Massive infrastructure investment delivering 300-500 Mbps speeds
- **Competitive Positioning**: Industry analysts note Verizon has "caught up remarkably quickly" despite later market entry
- **Fiber Leadership**: New 5 Gbps Fios tier establishes fastest residential broadband service in US
- **Infrastructure Dominance**: Combined wireless and wireline strategy creates comprehensive network advantage

## Featured Quote
*"This is transformational for our customers. C-band provides the perfect balance of speed and coverage that makes 5G truly useful for everyday applications."*  
— Kyle Malady, Chief Technology Officer, Verizon

## Sources
- [Fierce Wireless: Verizon's C-band 5G now reaches 230 million people](https://www.fiercewireless.com/2024/11/12/verizon-c-band-reaches-230m-pops)
- [Light Reading: Verizon deploys 5G Ultra Wideband in 15 major stadiums](https://www.lightreading.com/2024/11/10/verizon-5g-ultra-wideband-stadium-deployment)
- [BroadbandNow: Verizon launches 5 Gbps Fios tier](https://www.broadbandnow.com/2024/11/06/verizon-5-gbps-fios-service-launch)
- [RCR Wireless: Verizon partners with AWS for 5G edge computing](https://www.rcrwireless.com/2024/11/04/verizon-aws-5g-edge-computing)
